citations.narrative:
At the time of inspection, the facility has two red foxes on exhibit. The facility’s current 3-year license does not have
authorization for wild and exotic canids.
Licenses authorize a specific number and specific type(s) of animals for the use of regulated activity (i.e., exhibiting).
Licensure with the USDA must specifically authorize the use of wild and exotic canids, which includes foxes. The licensee
must either remove this animal from exhibition or must obtain a new license which authorizes the use of this category of
animal before continuing to exhibit this animal.
To be corrected from this date, September 17, 2025, forward.

In the enclosure housing three kunekune pigs, there are multiple leftover screws where wood boards have deteriorated or
have been removed. The points of these screws extend into the enclosure where the pigs can access them.
Enclosures that are not kept in good repair can result in injury from sharp points. The facility must be constructed of such
material and of such strength as appropriate for the animals involved. The housing facilities shall be maintained in good
repair to protect the animals from injury and to contain the animals.
The facility corrected the issue by removing the screws during the inspection.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives.
n

narrative:
2.1(b)(2)(ii) 
   
Requirements and application 
At the time of inspection, the facility has two red foxes on exhibit. The facility’s current 3-year license does not have 
authorization for wild and exotic canids. 
Licenses authorize a specific number and specific type(s) of animals for the use of regulated activity (i.e., exhibiting). 
Licensure with the USDA must specifically authorize the use of wild and exotic canids, which includes foxes. The licensee 
must either remove this animal from exhibition or must obtain a new license which authorizes the use of this category of 
animal before continuing to exhibit this animal. 
To be corrected from this date, September 17, 2025, forward. 
3.125(a) 
   
Facilities, general. 
In the enclosure housing three kunekune pigs, there are multiple leftover screws where wood boards have deteriorated or 
have been removed. The points of these screws extend into the enclosure where the pigs can access them.  
Enclosures that are not kept in good repair can result in injury from sharp points. The facility must be constructed of such 
material and of such strength as appropriate for the animals involved. The housing facilities shall be maintained in good 
repair to protect the animals from injury and to contain the animals.  
The facility corrected the issue by removing the screws during the inspection. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives.
